channel.title: Ed Brisson on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in Ed Brisson on jverkamp.com

item.title: Dead Man Logan, Vol. 2: Welcome Back, Logan
item.description:
And so it ends as it began. Logan and a Hulk, in the Wastelands.

The best part? Saberteeth. So many Sabertooths. Sabertoothipode?

item.title: Dead Man Logan, Vol. 1: Sins of the Father
item.description:
And so he has an expiration date:

I feel like it’s been a long time coming. He either has to figure out some way to heal… or move on from this world that isn’t even his in the first place.

item.title: Wolverine: Old Man Logan, Vol. 10: End of the World
item.description:
Part one:

Obviously.

Burning time, but it’s a fun enough adventure.

Part two:

And so it ends as it started. Logan and a Hulk.

Decent for closure even if the actual ending was abrupt at best.

Onward… to Dead Man Logan.

item.title: Wolverine: Old Man Logan, Vol. 9: The Hunter and the Hunted
item.description:
The hand returns…

No, not that Hand. Logan’s hand. The one with the adamantium claws. I’ve actually enjoyed seeing him with the mismatched claws for a few volumes now.

Bit of a bummer, other than that. More spinning wheels with nowhere to go for Old Man Logan.

item.title: Wolverine: Old Man Logan, Vol. 8: To Kill For
item.description:
First half: Kingpin has gone all respectable! On the surface. Again.

It’s impressive that keeps working.

Bullseye is a weird character. Logan’s eye is not healing. And that’s about it

Second half: An Old Geezer and some Z-list X-Men defend the school from… dating site scams?

Cute. But also nothing special.

item.title: Wolverine: Old Man Logan, Vol. 7: Scarlet Samurai
item.description:
The hand! Samurai! Resurrection!

That’s a hot mess of a story—although some of that is probably not really having the background for who a lot of these people are. So it goes.

It was nice actually (sort of) seeing Logan deal with the slower healing factor. I feel like though most of this we’ve heard of it, but no real problems.

Fun enough read. Onward!

item.title: Wolverine: Old Man Logan, Vol. 6: Days of Anger
item.description:
Hulks! Maestro!

Apparently in all the wacky parallel universe shenanigans, Maestro “rescued” a bunch of Hulks and brought them back to this world.

Knowing basically nothing about how Maestro came to be or what all these Hulks can actually do, it’s a strange story.
